meanings.definition: A small amount of liquid that has been mixed with air
meanings.sent1: After washing the dishes, there were suds left in the sink.
meanings.sent2: The soap created suds when mixed with water.
meanings.sent3: The bubble bath made so many suds, it looked like a fluffy cloud in the tub.
meanings.sent4: The suds on the surface of the river sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: As the washing machine churned, a mountain of suds overflowed from the door.

meanings.definition: To be covered or soaked in suds
meanings.sent1: I accidentally sud my shirt while doing the laundry.
meanings.sent2: The car suded up nicely with the car wash soap.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy suded itself in bubbles during bath time.
meanings.sent4: She suded her hands vigorously to create a lather.
meanings.sent5: The children laughed as they sud each other in a playful soap fight.

meanings.sent1: When I added soap to the water, it suded up instantly.
meanings.sent2: The detergent suded as soon as it touched the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The fountain suded with excitement as the soap was added to the water feature.
meanings.sent4: The river suded as it rushed over the rocks, creating a frothy spectacle.
meanings.sent5: The washing machine suded loudly, signaling the start of the laundry cycle.
